question: Determine the vertical displacements at A of the pin-connected  structure in Figure P9.31. Given: E = 200 GPa,  AAB = 1000 mm2 , and AAC = AAD = 500 mm2 . <image 1>
description: The image depicts a pin-connected structure consisting of three members labeled AB, AC, and AD. The structure is supported by pins at points B, C, and D, which are horizontally aligned and spaced 4 meters apart. Member AB is inclined at an angle from point A to point B, member AC is vertical from point A to point C, and member AD is inclined at an angle from point A to point D. Point A is subjected to a downward force of 200 kN. The height from points B, C, and D to point A is 4 meters. The cross-sectional areas of the members are given as \(A_{AB} = 1000 \, \text{mm}^2\) and \(A_{AC} = A_{AD} = 500 \, \text{mm}^2\). The modulus of elasticity (E) is specified as 200 GPa.
